results.t: DROP BACK | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: to move to a position that is lower or farther away from something or someone: The temperatures soon dropped back to normal.
Aug 30, 2024 — 1. retreat 2. to move straight back from the line of scrimmage the quarterback drops back to pass.
Step back, retreat. For example, When it was time for a group picture, Mary dropped back. Discover More Example Sentences
6 days ago — 1. to move back; retreat 2. drop behind See full dictionary entry for drop Webster's New World College Dictionary, 4th Edition.
take position in the rear, as in a military formation or in the line of scrimmage in football. “The defender dropped back behind his teammate”.

results.t: DROP BACK Synonyms: 42 Similar and Opposite Words
results.p: Aug 30, 2024 — Definition of drop back as in to withdraw to move back or away (as from something difficult, dangerous, or disagreeable)
noun. a lowering, as of prices or standards, especially to a previous level: Auto manufacturers requested a dropback in emissions standards.
phrasal verb to move more slowly than other people so that they get ahead of you. He started out with the leaders but at the first fence he dropped back.
